alert.note: Alert for Northern Sangre de Cristo Mountains Between 8500 And 11000 Ft; Northern Sangre de Cristo Mountains above 11000 Ft; Northwestern Fremont County Above 8500Ft; Southern Sangre De Cristo Mountains Above 11000 Ft; Southern Sangre De Cristo Mountains Between 7500 and 11000 Ft; Western, Central Fremont County Below 8500 Ft; Wet Mountain Valley Below 8500 Ft; Wet Mountains above 10000 Ft; Wet Mountains between 6300 and 10000Ft (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 20 at 2:58PM MST until January 22 at 8:00AM MST by NWS Pueblo
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM NOON FRIDAY TO 8 AM MST SATURDAY... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 3 to 8 inches, mainly above 6500 feet. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph. * WHERE...the Sangre de Cristo and Wet Mountain Ranges, the Wet Mountain Valley along with western and central Fremont County. * WHEN...From noon Friday to 8 AM MST Saturday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Gusty winds could produce areas of blow snow reducing area visibilities, mainly over mountain passes. Travel could be difficult over La Veta Pass on Saturday morning.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
